question.wording: 1- What does CSS mean?:
2- How can we add a comment in a CSS style sheet?:

choices.choice: Between the characters "/*" and "*/ ". Ex: /* this is a CSS comment */
Between the tags "< !--" and "-- >". Ex: < !-- This is a CSS comment -- >
After the characters "//". Ex: // This is a CSS comment

question.wording: 3- In which section of the HTML page can we define an internal CSS style sheet?:
question.choices: In the < footer > section In the < head > section Can be defined in any section of the page In the < body > section

question.wording: 4- In HTML there is the 'class' attribute. In relation to CSS styles, what do you think it is for?:

choices.choice: To apply specific styles (which are defined in an internal or external CSS sheet) to elements that have the same class, that is, the same value in that attribute.
To indicate the kind of style that we are going to apply to the element/HTML tag that carries that attribute: inline, internal sheet or external CSS
It is specific to indicate the color of the font that we want to apply, For example: p class="red" would present the letters in red for that paragraph
It has nothing to do with styles. It is really used to classify the type of link ('a') that we are defining: internal link or to a page in our same domain or to an external website

question.wording: 5- What is wrong in this style rule?:

choices.choice: You cannot put a '.' (dot) at the beginning of a statement (before the word 'table)'
Missing ';' (semicolon) at the end of the 'border' style declaration
A ',' (comma) is missing between the two values ​​of the padding property (10px 5px)
The border property can only be given one value and not 3 as shown here: 1px, blue and dotted

9- In absolute positioning, the origin of coordinates will depend on whether the element to be positioned is contained within another that is previously positioned absolutely or relatively:

choices.choice: True, because otherwise the page would be upside down
False, absolute positioning does not exist

question.wording: 10- We want to make a web document where the base font of the entire page is: black, Arial type, with a size 0.9 times the browser's default font and a line spacing of 1.4. What would be the CSS rule that achieves this?:

choices.choice: body { font: 0.9em/1.4 Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; colour: 000#; }
